Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2012 01:33PM momma4boys wrote: Hi all, I went to the Breast Oncologist today, who has set me up for an MRI this Wednesday,  she did feel the lump, wants to see if she can see on MRI, Since unable to see on US AND Mammo.  I am feel good about getting the MRI, how often does an MRI pick lumps and are correct anyone know?

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2012 01:31PM momma4boys wrote: well, the waiting continues....my Insurance denied an MRI, so now I will be getting a biopsy but she is booked til Nov 9th.  I keep telling myself it will be ok, this is Gods plan, but this waiting game is very hard.  I am so worried that she will miss the lump due to the fact that the US didnt pick it up the first time, and thats how the biopsies are guided is that correct?  How long does it normally take to get these reults back?

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2012 01:40PM momma4boys wrote: do you guys know if the itching and prickly type burning could be related?  Did you all have and symptoms other than lump?
Posts.Title: going to Breast Oncologist Monday momma4boys momma4boys

Posts.Content: momma4boys wrote: Hi, I am 40 years ols with 4 sons and a wonderful husband, I found a lump 4 months ago.  Went to my OBGYN, who then sent me for a Mam and US, none of which showed the lump, but was felt by my Doctor and I can feel it daily.  I was told to watch it, but my Gut told me to go get  A 2nd look.  So tomorrow I go to see the breast Oncologist. My symptoms are 1 lump, it seems to be deep, hard to feel at times, and hard, no pain, Breast does itch, and I have a burning sensation in my back should blade from time to time.  My Father passed away from Pancreatic Cancer, not sure if that could be a risk factor.  Im getting scared, I am a fighter if the news is bad, but I just have this feeling it may come back cancerous.  I want a biopsy done to know for sure, I have 4 kids to live for and I need a defenitive answer...Do you all think I am jumping to fast? Thanks in advance for your input....blessings.
